channel.description: Recent content in Git on DevOps Engineer

item.title: Conventional Branch Specification One-Year Anniversary â€” From Zero to Global Developer Adoption
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: 12K+ visits, multilingual translations, and global developer adoptionâ€”the journey of the Conventional Branch specification’s first year

item.title: Enhancing Code Traceability â€” Automatically Including PR Descriptions in Git Commits
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: Leverage Bitbucket’s Commit Message Templates feature to automatically write PR descriptions into Git commit messages, ensuring crucial information isn’t lost with tool changes.

item.title: ðŸš€ gitstats Upgrade Arrivesâ€”JSON Output, Cross-Platform Compatibility, and Code Refactoring!
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: After two months of continuous improvement, gitstats now supports JSON output, code refactoring, argparse replacing getopt, and full compatibility with Windows and macOS. Welcome to use and Star support!

item.title: Reviving GitStats â€” Breathing New Life into Git History Analysis
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This post details the revival of the GitStats project, including its migration to Python 3, the creation of a modern CI/CD pipeline, publication to PyPI and Docker, and future improvement plans.

item.title: Conventional Branch Specification Released!
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article introduces the Conventional Branch specification, which provides a structured naming convention for Git branches to enhance readability and collaboration.

item.title: Programmer's Self-Cultivation â€” Git Commit Message and Branch Creation Conventions (Tools)
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article introduces how to use the Commit Check tool to verify whether Git commit messages, branch names, committer usernames, and committer email addresses conform to specifications.

item.title: How to create GPG keys and add to GitHub
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article explains how to create GPG keys, export the public key, and add it to GitHub for signing commits.

item.title: Reliably Unforking a GitHub Repository Without Deletion and Reconstruction
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article describes how to separate a forked repository from its parent repository using GitHub Support, avoiding data loss from deletion and reconstruction, and helping developers better manage forked repositories.

item.title: Solving Two Git Clone Failure Issues on AIX
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article documents two issues encountered when using Jenkins for Git clone on AIX and their solutions, including dependent library loading failure and SSH authentication failure.

item.title: Resolving Git Large Repository Download Failures on AIX by Removing File Resource Limits
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: Resolving Git large repository download failures on AIX due to file size limits by modifying ulimit settings.

item.title: Branch Naming Convention
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article introduces the conventional branch naming specification, including the purpose of branch names, key points, and basic rules for naming branches in Git. It also provides examples of branch prefixes and their meanings.

item.title: These settings in Bitbucket/GitHub recommends enable
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: Provides a list of recommended settings for Bitbucket and GitHub repositories, including enabling force push rejection, branch protection, tag management, merge checks, and commit message standards.

item.title: git sparse-checkout enable and disable
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article explains how to enable and disable git sparse-checkout, including examples of how to configure sparse-checkout for specific directories and how to reset it.

item.title: Programmer's Self-Cultivation â€” Git Commit Message and Branch Creation Conventions
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article introduces how to formulate and implement Git commit message and branch creation conventions to improve code quality and team collaboration efficiency.

item.title: How to Slim Down Your Git Repository
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: How to remove unnecessary files and history from a Git repository to reduce its size, providing two methods using BFG Repo Cleaner or git filter-branch.

item.title: Git History Statistics Generator
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: GitStats, a Git history statistics generation tool written in Python, can generate detailed code submission statistical reports to help developers analyze project activity and contributor information.

item.title: Resolving the "Could not read from remote repository" Issue
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: Resolving the “Could not read from remote repository” error encountered when cloning code using Git, analyzing the causes, and providing solutions.

item.title: Git Commit Squash
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: How to squash multiple Git commits into a single commit, both locally and remotely, using interactive rebase and merge strategies in Bitbucket.
